sentences.english: Having pulled up his home he dismounted and walked up to us.
sentences.chinese: 他勒住马缰绳，然后下马向我们走来。

sentences.english: Do not derange the bridle hand.
sentences.chinese: 注意握缰绳的手不要动。

sentences.english: He steadied the horse with a tight rein.
Still, the central bank has begun to tug gently at the reins.
sentences.chinese: 但是央行已经开始轻轻拉住缰绳。

sentences.english: Never leave a halter on a horse that is turned loose.
sentences.chinese: 不要将松开的缰绳挂在马身上。

sentences.english: The young Mongolian girl dropped her bridle and let the horse drink of the running water.
sentences.chinese: 年轻的蒙古姑娘放掉缰绳，让马喝些水。

sentences.english: His jerkings on the reins only added to the horse's wildness.
sentences.chinese: 他急拉缰绳，只使得马更加狂暴了。

sentences.english: He tossed the reins of his horse to a small piccaninny standing near and started up the steps.
sentences.chinese: 他把马缰绳扔给一个站在旁边的小黑奴，便开始上楼。

sentences.english: He jogged the reins and the horse started up.
sentences.chinese: 他轻轻一抖缰绳，马儿就起步了。

sentences.english: The Horseman's Reins should again function in Dalaran.
sentences.chinese: 无头骑士的缰绳可以在达拉然使用。

sentences.english: The thief gave all the horses a bridle.
sentences.chinese: 小偷给所有的马放了缰绳。

sentences.english: Phaethon jumped onto horse-drawn carriage, is pleased to start with Jiang Sheng.
sentences.chinese: 法厄同跳上马车，高兴地抓起缰绳。

sentences.english: He loosened rein, and away they went a second time.
sentences.chinese: 他把缰绳索一松，第二次向山下冲去。

sentences.english: The horse responds to the slightest pull on the rein .
sentences.chinese: 只要缰绳稍稍一拉，这匹马就有反应。

definition: horse's head/same as 碼頭|码头[ma3 tou2], pier
to urge on a horse using a whip or spurs
to guide a horse with the reins/to rein in a horse
to whip on/to raise a whip/by ext. to swagger
to dismount from a horse/(fig.) to abandon (a project)
to turn/to turn around/to transfer (funds etc)
